column4: does anybody know how to make the screen resolution permanent? - each time I log in I have a 1025x768 res. then I have to set it to 1280x1024 next time i login I have to do the same all over again...
heard of it.. but people say do it on your own risk..
what shall I do with it?
you can change your resolution in it from the command line. Now, with that said, you can make a script that'll do that every bootup
I see.. what about edditing manually the xorg.org once and for good?
Also a good idea. You may need to create something called a "modeline"
I think I added one, but it doesn't seem to help
run "xrandr" with no arguments. 1280x1024 should show up... does it?
did it - that's what it says:
that's good... that means Ubuntu detects that resolution
weird how it doesn't select it.
In my experience, adding the modeline only gets Ubuntu to detect the mode
so I doubt that would work, but hey, worth a shot, right? Always backup your xorg.conf!
right. thanks a lot for the idea.. I'll give that a try
hey, I think it worked - loged out and back in and it is the good resolution..
